system.description:
You learn specialized magic usually only entrusted to the servants of the gods.

You add the Dispel Evil and Good and Hallow spells to your spellbook.

You also add the Forbiddance spell at level 11, the Divine Ward spell at level 13, and the Antimagic Field spell at level 15. None of these spells count against your wizard spell choices for their respective levels.

You also learn the Break Spell maneuver and your exertion pool increases by 2 points. If you already know it, you may choose another 2nd- or 3rd- degree maneuver from the Tempered Iron school or from another combat tradition that utilizes or nullifies magic.

Finally, you gain advantage on saving throws to avoid taking psychic damage or gaining levels of strife from any source but your own spells or features.
